intro: Colignonia glomerata var. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian colignonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cooler, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
